Blue.description: You want people to return to game night, and a little bit of competitive fun helps!
You probably buy more big cool board games than your friends’ have time for!
As their host, you’re in the perfect position to cause some chaos, and read the room appropriately.
An exceptionally considerate host, who may request to only host cooperative game nights.
You might find an urge to plan smaller game nights to play your more relaxing games.
You seek to set the stage to tell the best jokes… all at your abode!
You believe in the magic of friends to make game night a blast!
When you’re hosting game night, everyone always gets to play the best designed games!
You definitely sprinkle in some role-playing games amidst the game nights!

Red.description: You love competition so much that you find yourself hosting game night… and possibly turning that into a tournament of some kind.
You love competitive games, and have a collection that screams that.
You believe that some chaos makes the competition even more fun!
You’re a courteous competitor, who may want to compete over team games.
You can have an imaginative, relaxed approach to winning.
Putting your effort towards winning is cool, but dominating while cracking a joke is even better.
What’s the point of competition without a bunch of friends to face off against?
You’re going to win at the best games ever created!
You can’t wait to tell people about the story of how you won.

Clear.description: You buy way more huge board games than your friends have time for!
Your knowledge of winning strategies is cool, but you know that your memorization of board game valuation is cooler.
You know the true value of a lot of chaotic games.
You know the true value of a lot of cooperative games.
You own and rarely enjoy a couple of your chill games.
You can imagine so many untold jokes within your shrink-wrapped collection!
You must be playing other people’s games, cause yours are still in shrink!
Not to fear about your unplayed shelf, since many of them will continue to be simply the best games ever!
All of these cool games tell an amazing story… if you get around to playing them.

Black.description: You love the chaos, but can you act this chaotic when it’s your board game night?
Sometimes you use chaos to disguise your real intentions of overwhelming victory!
You wonder if you’ll use a chaotic play style for your shrink-wrapped game… when you get around to playing it, of course!
Chaos is good, but you don’t want to step on anyone’s toes.
Causing chaos is peak gaming, but sometimes you want to play something more chill.
The hilarity just instantly comes to you after causing some chaos!
Chaos is great in a big crowd, with so many more minds to mess with!
You love to shake up games, but you know which games are too well designed to break.
You’ll sit back after an epic finish, regaling others of your chaotic plays!

White.description: You relish in working together.. and coming together for game night is also a type of cooperation to enjoy!
You’re competitive over cooperative games, against the game or against others!
It’d be great to cooperate on your unplayed coops, but it’s really up to what the group wants.
Sometimes you just want to spice cooperation up with chaos… as long as no one gets hurt.
You mostly like to work together, but would be totally fine with playing competitively on your own boards!
You admire cooperation, and telling jokes can make the team gel even better!
You delight in cooperation, whether it be with old friends or new.
If you’d have it your way, you’d like to mostly play the best cooperative games.
You would love to tell a story… about how the team pulled through!

Green.description: You really enjoy a chill time for board games, and can find yourself inviting others over to make it happen.
You’re easily immersed in your board. but you sometimes feel an irresistible itch to win.
You love peaceful games, but what isn’t as settling is your unplayed collection.
You’re a very uncommon combination as you enjoy peaceful games but then don’t mind some chaos in between.
You’ll find yourself looking up from your board to crack a joke, then returning to its serenity.
You have a knack for getting along with anyone, but sometimes you’d rather just enjoy the game in front of you.
You know the best peaceful games have been the ones that have been meticulously designed and heavily vetted.
You’re one of the most imaginative personalities: you’re in it for a chill, grounded time with a cool story to boot.

Yellow.description: It can sometimes be easier for you to be the clown when you set up game night!
You hope others can take a good joke, and some good competition.
You love to jest, but others know the best joke of all is your pile of unplayed games.
You easily follow up your game-altering plays with well-timed jokes!
You being hilarious is fun for everyone, as long as you don’t step on anyone’s toes.
Sometimes you want to take a break from the wise-crackin’ to be swept up by the game’s chillness.
It’s easy for you to tell a joke to anyone, new or old at the table!
Your class clown aspect can really shine if the game is actually good.
You do the silly plays, which create a silly story, which lead to even more jokes!

Purple.description: You’re THE social butterfly, often hosting game nights for your ever increasing invite list.
Others know better to be fooled by your friendly exterior, because you can still be quite serious about outcomes.
You probably have a ton of friends, but not enough outlets for your pile of unplayed games!
You can seamlessly weave in chaos with both new and old friends at the table!
While you’re here for what the party wants to play, team games are your jam!
You wouldn’t mind alternating the bombastic game sessions with a more subdued night of socializing.
You’re probably the most performative one at the table, able to break the ice with anyone new!
You’re mostly here for the people, but you’d really prefer it if you got to play a GOOD game while you’re at it.
You don’t shut up about past stories you all made together at game night!

Natural.description: You have the best games, and so when you send an invite to play, you’re all gonna play the best!
You really understand the games with the perfect amount of conflict.
You’re really serious about games… but maybe you’re not playing them as much as you’d like.
You love something carefully designed, but it’s also ok to let loose and cause some chaos!
Your big draw to board games is likely due to how they’re an excellent way to work together!
You tend to easily impress others with your knowledge of peaceful games!
You can be stern about design… but what’s the fun without a couple of jokes to blow off some steam?
You’re fascinated by social interactions in games, and aren’t opposed to a bigger group to test your theories.
You relish researching to find the best mechanics for the best story.

Parchment.description: You love a good story, which can happen more often if you host game night!
Offense may create some of your best stories: attack attack attack!
You’re prone to daydreaming about board game stories of old, when you could just play your shrink wrapped campaigns.
Your board game stories may be definitely more on the chaotic side…
Creating a story together is wholesome, specifically as a team is best!
The story of how your personal board came along is your go-to gaming enjoyment.
You love to inject narration to the story… that can also be said for the laughs.
Your great story can often be enhanced by more characters around the table!
A fantastic story is always fun for you to weave, but the night is best if the mechanics came together with story perfectly.
